The asymmetry between ℓ⁺ℓ⁺ and ℓ⁻ℓ⁻ allows us to compare the probabilities for {bar B}° → B° and B° → {bar B}° oscillations and thus probe T and CP invariance. A sample of 20,381 same-sign dilepton events is selected in the 1999--2000 data sample, corresponding to an integrated luminosity of 20.7 fb⁻¹ on the Υ(4S) resonance. We measure a same-sign dilepton asymmetry of A{sub T} = (0.5 ± 1.2 ± 1.4)%; for the parameter ε{sub B} representing T and CP violations in mixing, we obtain a preliminary result of Re(ε{sub B})/1 + The asymmetry between ℓ⁺ℓ⁺ and ℓ⁻ℓ⁻ allows us to compare the probabilities for {bar B}° → B° and B° → {bar B}° oscillations and thus probe T and CP invariance. A sample of 20,381 same-sign dilepton events is selected in the 1999--2000 data sample, corresponding to an integrated luminosity of 20.7 fb⁻¹ on the Υ(4S) resonance. notes_summary_ssim: We report a study of T and CP violation in B°{bar B}° mixing using an inclusive dilepton sample collected by the BABAR experiment at the PEP-II B Factory. The asymmetry between ℓ⁺ℓ⁺ and ℓ⁻ℓ⁻ allows us to compare the probabilities for {bar B}° → B° and B° → {bar B}° oscillations and thus probe T and CP invariance. A sample of 20,381 same-sign dilepton events is selected in the 1999--2000 data sample, corresponding to an integrated luminosity of 20.7 fb⁻¹ on the Υ(4S) resonance. We measure a same-sign dilepton asymmetry of A{sub T} = (0.5 ± 1.2 ± 1.4)%; for the parameter ε{sub B} representing T and CP violations in mixing, we obtain a preliminary result of Re(ε{sub B})/1 +
